4f3d5fbbc3650224.title: Business Change Analyst
4f3d5fbbc3650224.company: Cambridgeshire and Peterborough NHS Foundation Trust
4f3d5fbbc3650224.description:
Previous applicants need not apply

We are looking for two full time Business change analysts to join our Clinical Systems team to support our optimisation programme for SystmOne following our successful go live of TPP’s SystmOne PAS for our Mental Health Teams. Now that all of CPFT is on SystmOne we have an exciting opportunity to Optimise, improve and standardise the way we use SystmOne across our Physical and Mental Health services within our trust.

We are looking for two people to join our Clinical Systems team who will play an essential role in the safe and effective design of the Trust EPR system to meet the needs of our clinical staff whilst transforming patient care.

The successful candidates will have previous experience in Project management and delivering Business change, as well as being able to demonstrate extensive knowledge of TTP’s SystmOne Functionality and Design and interest in patient safety is essential to this role.

You will need to be a highly motivated individual with an analytical mind, a focus on attention to detail, be able to work independently in an organised yet flexible manner and have excellent communication skills.

To provide support to the Clinical Systems Teams management of the Trust’s core clinical systems and electronic patient records.

To work closely with clinical staff to define current service processes and map them against SystmOne or any other chosen system functionality that is required.

To identify any new changes needed in the configuration of the chosen system and the development of new clinical tools within the system.

To be responsible for the delivery of Business Change activities related to the deployment of all Clinical Systems projects.

Will be required to work closely with the services and to report to the Project Manager/Clinical Systems Team manager as required.

The post holder will promote and champion the use of technology to enhance clinical services.

From 1 April 2022 all job roles that involve patient contact will require the post holder to have completed a full course of authorised COVID-19 vaccine doses, unless they have a medical exemption. (Under Parliamentary review)

Cambridgeshire & Peterborough NHS Foundation Trust is a health & social care organisation dedicated to providing high quality care with compassion to improve the health & wellbeing of the people we care for, as well as supporting & empowering them to lead a fulfilling life.

Our clinical teams deliver many NHS services not only via inpatient and primary care setting but also with the community. These services include Children, Adult & Older Peoples mental & physical health, Forensic & Specialist mental health, Learning Disabilities, Primary Care & Liaison psychiatry, Substance misuse, Social care, Research & Development.

To achieve our goal, we look to recruit high calibre candidates that share our vision & values. As an equal opportunities employer, we encourage applications from all sectors of the community, particularly from under-represented groups including disabled people & members of our ethnic minorities & LGBTQ+ communities.

CPFT encourages and supports vaccination uptake, as this remains the best line of defence against Covid-19

Please refer to the attached job description and person specification for full details of responsibilities.
1. To work with clinical services and analyse “as-is” processes and challenge historical ways of working where appropriate.
2. To produce “as-is” and “to-be” process flows using Microsoft Visio & engage with Service Managers for approvals.
3. Design and document new “to-be” processes incorporating the new software functionality and the current “as-is” processes.
4. To assist in the writing of the Business Change Plans for each Service using the agreed “to-be” processes.
5. Offer advice and guidance on effective use of clinical systems, including agile working capabilities and emerging cross provider systems and processes.
6. To communicate key benefits messages to all services to gain widespread involvement and stakeholder buy-in to the project so that people have an understanding of why the changes are being made.
7. Engage and work with all members of the Clinical Systems Team including application trainers to roll out new functionality as smoothly as possible.
8. Test software functionality for the “to-be” processes and identify any key issues in the clinical system test environment.
9. Gather all required information for configuration including existing paper forms, letters, etc. Design and create local clinical data templates based on service identified requirements.
10. Escalate issues and concerns to a Clinical Systems Team Manager/Project Manager.
11. Ensure that the processes implemented are compliant with NHS security standards and requirements and does not pose a clinical risk.
12. To lead on specific projects as required for services across CPFT.
13. Assist the Clinical Systems Manager, their delegates and Clinical Systems project managers in delivery of the IT projects run by the Clinical Systems Team.
14. Monitoring, advising and maintaining Data Quality and Information Governance requirements
15. Carry out system configuration work as required and specified by the Clinical Systems Manager or their delegates
16. Provide second and third level support for CPFT clinical systems, including the operation of a clinical systems helpdesk function. These systems include (but are not limited to) SystmOne, MHCT, OpenWard, PC-MIS, e-Referral, Datix
17. Support implementation of processes for second level support change requests, including understanding of the change request, offering evaluation of the impact and communicating back to Clinical Systems Manager.
18. Ensure a robust impact assessment is incorporated into all changes to understand scale and impact of the change, including any reporting requirements.
19. To ensure suggestions for change align to the trust standards and process

Founded in 1856 by Thomas Burberry, Burberry is a global luxury brand with a distinctly British attitude. We are a global business with an extensive network of both owned and franchised stores across EMEIA, Asia Pacific and Americas. We are digital pioneers, and innovative technology underpins every aspect of our business, from product design to distribution and marketing. We believe that modern luxury means being socially and environmentally responsible; this mindset is core to our business and key to our long-term success.

JOB PURPOSE

The role of the Business Analyst is to provide clarity on what is required for our technology solutions to satisfy business requirements from all stakeholder groups. They work with the business to analyse, ratify and document requirements and processes, thus helping delivery teams to prioritise deliveries to maximise business value.
We are looking for a Business Analyst to work within our Marketing Technology team, to help bridge the gap between the business needs and the technical requirements on a range of complex, challenging and strategically key initiatives. You will work in partnership with your delivery team to identify & implement solutions that help to create innovative customer-centric marketing journeys, which will aim to meet the needs of our broader Digital strategy.
You will be joining a team of skilled professionals including Product Owners, Project Managers, Development and Creative teams, and will be part of and working closely with a wider community of Business Analysts within the Digital portfolio and across the organisation.
Cultural fit is really important to us - we work in a fast-paced, dynamic and highly collaborative environment and look for individuals who thrive in this type of setting. We also look for lateral thinkers who can think outside of the box and are capable of confidently and effectively challenging scope and solutions, for the better.

Engage with the Product Owner, stakeholders, third party venders and others as needed to ratify, align and sense-check the ‘what’ (requirement), the ‘why’ (benefit) and the ‘how’ (solution)
Enable delivery of scope - utilise agile tools (JIRA, confluence, etc) to communicate and document clear, unambiguous functional and non-functional business requirements to agreed standards
Help to facilitate and actively participate in Agile delivery ceremonies - backlog grooming sessions, stand ups, reviews, retrospectives and product demos
Map business process changes resulting from implementation of new features and/or initiatives
Support, evolve and consistently contribute to maintaining high-quality ways of working and outputs from the Digital BA team

Experience working in an offshore/distributed team model

9ae64de03e13be79.title: Senior Business Analyst - Release Train
9ae64de03e13be79.description:
We’re Building a Brighter Future that is All Together Better

The Chief Information and Digital function at The Coventry is changing; we are currently undertaking an exciting transformation that will shape the future of the organisation and embrace agile ways of working with a focus on early and incremental release of value.
As we progress on our journey, we are seeking talented individuals who are passionate about delivering an outstanding experience for both members and colleagues in an environment where you will have the opportunity to be part of the future success of the organisation and work in an environment where personal and professional development is taken seriously.

What You’ll Be Doing

As a Senior Business Analyst (Release Train) you will undertake the coordination lead for business analysis aligned to an Agile Release Train. Working closely with the Release Train Engineer, you will have responsibility for supporting the approach, other SBAs and BAs within the teams inside the release train and supporting critical assessment of activity and helping to shape and create the train level backlog alongside the Product Manager

A core part of the role will be to work closely with all other train level roles to ensure the clarity of and alignment to delivery and maintenance of features aligned to corporate strategy and committed outcomes as set through increment planning activity. The role requires significant interaction with business stakeholders and third parties to help ensure customer and value-based outcomes are captured in the release train backlog of work.

You will support the product strategy and road-map, with the ability to translate the stakeholder’s vision of the product into the business needs and communicate it to the team members to make them understand the expectations

Working with all teams within the train, helping embed BAs and SBAs by ensuring their work is aligned to the train level objectives and the analysis work contributing to the team back logs is of sufficient quality to enable teams to develop effectively and commit to goals.
You will also support the Practice in the continuous improvement of Business Analysis within the product model at the Society, helping ensure that the Practice is leading the way in collaborative, effective, straightforward and high-quality Business Analysis.


About You
You’ll be a Servant Leader

You’ll need to be an authentic ‘servant leader’ who takes responsibility for enabling your team’s success and achieving the Society’s shared goals through the CIDO function, ahead of your own objectives.

You’ll have excellent stakeholder management skills with the ability to influence business decisions and command credibility at all levels, building and managing relationships across the Agile Release Train.

You’ll maintain an understanding of the overarching business strategy and the impact that design decisions have on stakeholders and customer value outcomes.

You’ll lead the feasibility and shaping of activities and features on the Release Train backlog and play a key role in keeping the product backlog prioritised and refined to plan the subsequent iterations and tasks for the next program increment.

You’ll excel at being a people developer and coach - demonstrable experience of building and developing high performing teams.

With great resilience you’ll maintain energy and enthusiasm and embrace situations positively. Emotional intelligence helps you understand your impact on others, always taking time to help others to operate at their best.

Constantly creating a culture of continuous improvement, learning from mistakes and use the experience to change how you and the team respond to similar situations in the future.

And You Will Have

Strong understanding of principles, theories, practices associated with Agile methodologies.
Demonstrable experience in an agile / scrum environment with an appreciation for working within a scaled environment.
Experience in Design Thinking and eliciting business outcomes and converting them to use cases, epics, and user stories with acceptance criteria.
Extensive process improvement experience, including experience that leverages technology as part of the solution.
Solid experience with process redesign methods (such as business process re- engineering or Six Sigma).
Knowledge of relevant business process standards (for example, Business Process Modelling Notation) and other business process analysis tools and methodologies.
Demonstrable experience of identifying and resolving team impediments.
Demonstrable experience of championing agility and agile principles both upwards and into the wider business and through into their Agile Release Train.
Advocacy for career paths and identifying development opportunities for members of your team; an ability to incubate and grow the talent pool.
About The Company
Who are Coventry Building Society?

We are the second largest Building Society in the UK and the 8th largest lender, we know a thing or two about Savings and Mortgages. The Society has grown significantly over the past decade and now has over 2700 employees and nearly 2 million members. The Society is a Which recommended Savings provider and we’re proud to be one of the Best Big Companies to work for in 2021.

We Value Diversity

We want you to feel accepted for who you are. We are committed to promoting a diverse and inclusive community, where you can succeed as your whole self.

To make good decisions a team needs different perspectives, drawing on different experiences and backgrounds. Teams with people who embrace difference and are curious about other points of view, innovate more, solve problems faster and achieve better outcomes. A culture where difference is valued and people can be themselves is a place where people can be brilliant.

We Believe in Flexibility For You

We value the individuality and diversity of our people and we are committed to attracting and retaining the very best people who reflect our values.

We recognise the importance of helping you to balance your working life with other priorities. This may include parental and other caring responsibilities, education, charity work, leisure activities and other interests.

And we’ve recognised the benefits of a hybrid working approach, with colleagues choosing whether they want to work from home or in our offices. It’s a team-led approach, with each area of the business deciding what works best for them.

Roke is a world-class technology and engineering consultancy. Roke delivers advanced research, development services and products to high profile customers who come to Roke with varied and challenging problems to solve.
We work directly with our clients to help achieve a safe and secure world by supporting the Public Sector and Law Enforcement sectors.
Public Sector is built on the three pillars of Technology, Innovation and Excellence. We are different to other companies because we focus on the “Business Unusual” and are unashamedly technically curious. Our world class innovation & technologic heritage and advanced intelligent insight enables our Consultants to deliver strategic advice, analysis, architecture and engineering capabilities to shape and deliver the most technically and business complex problems.
The ability to produce and implement robust business analysis to support solutions for our customers is of primary importance for the business. Understanding the customer’s organisational strategy, in addition to business analysis and client roadmaps, are vital in helping us achieve that.
Primary Job Purpose
As a Technical Business Analyst you will support our clients and internal capability development in the technical vertical with all the activities around the implementation of solution using technology/tools/models/techniques.You’ll work with stakeholders to determine the contribution that technical business and IT improvements can make to achieving business objectives; defining technical strategies, agreeing and prioritising technical business requirements, conducting feasibility studies, producing both organisational-level and detailed business models, and overseeing the definition and implementation of holistic solutionsSpend a minimum of 70% time on CFU to understand, develop and implement solutions for our customers. Provide intelligence to wider Roke and assist in winning new work and catalysing our journey to prime.
Key Responsibilities
Exhibit analytical skills - demonstrate problem solving, qualitative, quantitative and visualization skills to resolve business/technical problems and apply logical thinking to come up with appropriate solutions.Participate in Technical analysis
Apart from the business perspective, a business analyst should analyze the requirements from the technical view-point also (by getting involved in discussions with the tech architects, tech leads and developers) and uncover any technical challenges that might come in fulfilling the requirements. All this might involve capturing data, creating metrics, evaluating dependencies and developing options.
Develop Data models and process flows - analyze and create graphical representations of the flow of data through the system, modeling its process aspects. The document generated from this exercise is called the data flow diagram (DFD).Create wireframes or mock-up interfaces - For evaluation and demonstration, a business analyst is required to create the wireframe or mock-up of the product to be developed. This wireframe is a high-level model of the product and assists in the user interface (UI) and user experience (UX) study of the product’s design.Technical documentation - provide technical support throughout the project lifecycle by either developing following documents or assisting their creation:
1. Context diagrams – used to show a high-level view of a system and the entities interacting with it.
2. Class diagrams – a type of static structure diagram that describes the structure of a system.
3. Entity–relationship diagram (ERD) – a model for describing the data or information aspects of a business process.
PERSON SPECIFICATION
Knowledge, Skills & Experience
To qualify for the role you should have:
Proven track-record in delivering business and technical consultancy projects within the UK Government, Private sector and Law Enforcement arena.Can influence at all levels of the organisation.A demonstrable capability in technical business analysis
Security
Due to the nature of this position, we require you to be eligible to achieve SC and/or DV clearance. As a result, you should be a British Citizen and have resided in the UK for the last 5 years for SC and 10 years for DV.

The International Private Bank is undertaking a major, multi-year, multi-million-dollar transformation initiative known as Dynamo. The programme will change almost every part of the platform from back office to front office, in order to deliver a modern solution that enables the business to scale effectively and flexibly. A particular area of focus is our investments platform, which we are re-engineering completely - this covers all major asset classes (equities, fixed income, FX, OTC and listed derivatives, structured products and alternatives).
As a senior business analyst in the investments squad, you will be responsible for defining the requirements of the solutions working closely with other functions in the squad such as front office, back office, design, legal, risk and compliance. You will ensure that the developers in the squad understand exactly what they need to make the software do, and you will help validate the software does what is intended and that it has a great user experience.
The private bank has moved to an agile, product-centric model for the delivery of the Dynamo programme, and the investments squad is made up of all relevant business functions with the goal of delivering a first-class investments platform.
Key Responsibilities:

Writing user stories, and turning business requirements and expectations into tangible software system requirements
Working with users and stakeholders to plan and conduct testing, and showcasing the output of each sprint
Helping the investments squad as a whole deliver a great solution for our customers

This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including:

Deep experience in at least one of the major asset classes (equities, fixed income, FX, OTC and listed derivatives, structured products or alternatives) - in any part of the lifecycle (e.g. front office, middle office and asset servicing, back office)
Ideally experience of an agile, product-centric way of working
Great communication skills to help everyone in the squad understand what is needed to create a superb solution
What you have worked on in the past is less important than your approach to solving problems and collaborating with others in the team - we are looking for very smart people who can bring different ways of thinking to problems and are keen to work on something that is genuinely transformational

The Asset and Wealth Management division is driven by innovators like you who are driven to create technology solutions that make us work more efficiently and help our businesses grow. It's our mission to efficiently take care of our clients' wealth, helping them get, and remain properly invested. Across 27 cities, our team of 4,600 agile technologists thrive in a cloud-native environment that values continuous learning using a data-centric approach in developing innovative technology solutions.
When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you're not just working at a global financial institution. You're an integral part of one of the world's biggest tech companies. In 15 technology centres worldwide, our team of 50,000 technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $11B annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that are transforming the financial services industry.
At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we're building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you're looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you.
Ready to use your expertise and experience to drive change? Apply today.
J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world's most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.

JOB TITLE: Senior Business Analyst
POSTING END DATE: 28/02/2021
LOCATION: UK - Gaydon

The successful candidate for the above role will retain their current employer, i.e. if you are a Jaguar employee you will continue to be administered on the Jaguar grading structure with the associated terms and conditions. If you are currently on BAC or EMC terms, you will retain your current employer but will transfer to a Jaguar Landrover contract and the associated terms and conditions.
WHAT TO EXPECT
Jaguar Land Rover is increasing its capability and capacity of its Digital workforce to identify and automate activities across the Enterprise to free up colleagues to focus on more interesting and strategic elements of their role. This exciting role is part of our Intelligent Process Automation Centre of Excellence (COE) which has evolved from our Robotic Process Automation COE and combines traditional RPA technology with cognitive / Artificial Intelligence capabilities, upskilling our Digital workforce to read, interpret, analyse and support colleagues with enhanced decision-making. These new capabilities, combined with process improvement capabilities, such as lean six sigma will be applied to processes across Jaguar Landrover in order to unlock efficiency across end-to-end value streams by optimising delivery and improving process compliance.
As part of our new Intelligent Process Automation CoE, this exciting role encapsulates process solution design and automation development to drive maximum benefits through use of RPA and other complimentary technologies, such as Smart Workflow tools, Optical Character Recognition (OC), Natural Language Processing (NLP), Python and SQL.
The Business Analyst will support the development of the IPA engagement strategy and approach across the business and works closely with internal customers, to identify business processes for automation, perform requirements gathering and assess opportunities. The RPA tool of choice at Jaguar Land Rover is Blue Prism, you’ll be experienced in working either with Blue Prism or with similar RPA tools, as well as have some knowledge and experience of other cognitive technologies.
WHAT YOU’LL NEED
The Business Analyst will engage with Jaguar Landrover internal customers at various levels to evangelise the use of IPA technologies and their associated benefits. They will be able to determine suitable candidate processes for automation and will ensure process definition and documentation are a suitable level of detail to enable automation delivery. The Business Analyst will help maintain the relationship between the customer and the Development team throughout the development lifecycle and will be the first point of escalation for our Customers experiencing any service disruption.
The Business Analyst will be responsible for developing and maintaining the IPA technology and capability playbook with use cases that offer a compelling IPA value proposition and example use cases. They will stay abreast of emerging and complimentary technologies and will make recommendations to on-board new technology partners to maximise business benefit and to ensure the RPA COE at Jaguar Land Rover continues to embrace digital technologies.
Knowledge, Skills and Experience
Product Management experience in developing and selling value propositions (preferably associated with Digital / Automation capabilities / technologies)
Experience in delivering presentations to senior management
Experience in designing and developing complex business cases
If you are an existing Jaguar Land Rover employee at the same grade as this position, please be aware that no pay increases are applied to lateral moves. For promotions, the salary offer will depend on a variety of factors including the size of and skills required for the role, the external market value of the role and your individual knowledge and experience.
Please note that if you elect to apply for a role in another country and are successful you would need to be hired as an external candidate on local terms and conditions rather than transferring on your existing terms.

Business Analyst

Salary ca £38,376- £41,715 based on experience

2 FTE positions available, 2-year fixed term contract

Permanently home based with regular travel to York, Northallerton and Harrogate


These are full time or part time opportunities and we are open to discuss individual’s flexible working needs during the recruitment process. So please do not hesitate to apply.


We have an exciting opportunity for ambitious and competent individuals to join the new Portfolio and Programme Management team, which delivers a challenging and exciting portfolio of change for North Yorkshire Police (NYP), North Yorkshire Fire and Rescue Service (NYFRS) and the Office of the Police, Fire and Crime Commissioner (OPFCC). Following significant new investment in this team, we have a number of vacancies available that will be contracted to either NYP or NYFRS.

As a Business Analyst, you will influence decision making through your thorough interrogation of all available evidence, build and evaluate options for change, develop business cases for estates, technology or business change projects and support the delivery of that change to drive value to front line services.
You will build excellent relationships with senior business leads across all three of our clients and ensure that services are delivered in an efficient and effective manner and align to the organisational priorities of the OPFCC, NYFRS and NYP. You will deliver excellent customer service and demonstrate real value to front line services. None of this is done in isolation. You will benefit from the excellent network of peers for support and guidance and work closely with colleagues in our enabling services teams, frontline services and partner organisations.


As Business Analyst you will be responsible for:

Provide expert, timely, risk weighted, analytical advice and guidance in the development of new business process models, functional specifications and supporting documentation to support projects and programme’s decision making.
Provide business analysis support to functions for business case development, work with project owners to co-ordinate cross-functional input and support with initial shaping, sizing and feasibility.
Identify options for driving improvement and providing return on investment including cost/benefit analysis, ensuring future solutions deliver efficient and effective services and comply with legislation, policies, procedures and statutory guidance.
Problem solve to find solutions to varied and complex issues when implementing change, facilitate information gathering workshops as required.
Act as decision point for whether a change initiative should be progressed through the change governance arrangements.

For a full description of responsibilities, please refer to the attached role profile.

The ideal candidate should possess the following skills and experience:

 Analytical experience of medium-to-large scale, multiple complex projects and programmes and / or utilisation of a range of strategic/ demand modelling techniques
 A detailed understanding of business benefits including how these are identified and measured
 Experience of test management for technology and/or business change
 Relationship management with internal and external customers
 Business Analysis/ Process modelling/ Strategic Analysis/ Demand Modelling qualifications (at least 1) is an essential requirement for the role e.g. Open University ‘Delivering Value’, ‘Mastering the Requirements Process, Six Sigma etc.


Also desirable are:
 Excellent understanding of technology life cycles and the concepts and practices required to implement effective information systems
 Experience of working in or with infrastructure / applications / technical environment
 Knowledge or practice of project methodology e.g. PRINCE 2, Agile


enableNY was established in April 2019, as the vehicle to transform police and fire collaboration in serving the public of North Yorkshire. enableNY encompasses the provision of financial, people, estates, technology, business design and assurance services to support North Yorkshire Police (NYP), North Yorkshire Fire & Rescue Services (NYFRS) and the Office of the Police, Fire and Crime Commissioner.

Business Design and Assurance provides business support services for North Yorkshire Police, North Yorkshire Fire and Rescue Services and the Office of the Police, Fire and Crime Commissioner. We have a number of vacancies available that will be contracted to either NYP or NYFRS.


 Working for us - what we can offer you


A career within enableNY will bring great pride and job satisfaction, through the services and support you will provide to two of North Yorkshire’s emergency services. You will make a real difference to the safety of everyone who works, travels, visits and lives in York and North Yorkshire. This role provides a great opportunity for you to build your skills, experience and credibility working for a forward thinking organisation.


You’ll receive a competitive salary and be entitled to the Local Government pension scheme, 24 days leave entitlement and other employee benefits. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities to everyone, no matter your ethnicity, gender, disability, sexual orientation, religion, gender identity, age or caring responsibilities.
Unison is the recognised Trade union within enableNY and there are also a number of other Inclusion and Diversity support networks. You’ll also benefit from discounts on shopping and eating out as part of the Blue Light Card scheme.


EnableNY has permanently committed to offer flexible working approaches, both with an agile approach to working location and being flexible in how you want to work your contracted hours, in order to support a healthy work life balance.


Internal NYP - Applications will be considered on a fixed term basis in line with the general principles of the secondment procedure. This means you must have successfully passed your probationary period and receive full support from your line manager and Head of Function before submitting an application. If successful, you will be appointed to this role on new Terms and Conditions.


External Applicants- If you are offered a fixed term contract, this means that your employment contract will end when the term finishes.


 Interviews will take place week commencing 7th March 2022.


To be considered please submit your application along with your CV by the 28th February 2022.

Job description
Your opportunity
Part Business. Part Creative. Part Technology. One hundred per cent digital. At Deloitte Digital, we connect creativity with technology for business. Bringing empathy, ideas, and experience into digital transformation. Together with all of Deloitte, we create connections across the breadth of our people, organisation, and ecosystems to make an impact that matters to our clients and to society. We’re a new type of creative digital consultancy that fuses strategy, tech and design to identify where businesses need to be, then get them there. Fast. Want to help us shape the future? We’re looking for experienced practitioners from a consulting, design, tech or business background who can show our clients what’s next, then work with our mixed-discipline team to make it happen.
As part of our Consultancy practice, your career with Deloitte Digital can take multiple paths. Including: customer and channel strategy, customer experience design, designing new service capabilities and operations, mobile, online and contact centre technology solutions, and related technology and operational change programmes.
We embrace the strengths of diverse talent within our team. You may have a brilliant mind, be a confident communicator or a nerd for all things digital, or you may have an impeccable business instinct, a collaborative outlook and a flair for big ideas.
We encourage consideration of flexible ways of working, both formal and informal arrangements that allow for the best outcomes for our people and our clients. If this opportunity is of interest to you with some flexibility, please do discuss with us.
Are you looking to return to the workplace after an extended career break?
For this role we can offer coaching and support designed for returners to refresh your knowledge and skills, and help your transition back into the workplace after a career break of 2 years or more. If this is relevant for you, just let your recruiter know when you make your application.
Your role
We’re expanding fast, so we’re looking for people who are, by which we mean natural initiative-takers who bring out the best in others, are brilliant listeners and can grow our business without compromising standards, integrity or culture.
You will work with outstanding digital talent across disciplines to innovate and create great solutions for iconic brands.
With experience in small to large business transformation, firm knowledge of programming methodologies and basic architectural principles, you’ll be an integral part in the technical design of new software and processes. You should be able to take requirements from a range of client stakeholders and evaluate the technical feasibility, complexity and impact of the solutions you produce.
Gather technical requirements to help solve some of the most exciting problems for our clients
Partner with iconic brands, translating requirements into documented criteria and deliverables
Evaluate the technical impacts and other business or change impacts that come as a result of the solutions you produce
Work effectively within multi-disciplinary teams following agile methodology
Analyse and understand full-stack codebases to help shape logical solutions
Deliver gap analysis against proposed technologies
Scope and plan the management of client projects
Demonstrate an appetite to continuously improve technical processes and ways of working
Collaborate with clients, developers and design teams to clarify requirements and with amazing digital experts across disciplines to innovate and deliver digital solutions
Work effectively in diverse teams within an inclusive team culture where people are recognised for their contribution
Your work, your choice
At Deloitte we believe the best impact is the value we add, not the hours we sit at our desk. We carefully consider agile ways of working, both formal and informal, that allow for the best impact for our people and our clients. Please speak to your recruiter about the working pattern that works best for you.
Location: Through our studios spread across the globe, we help our clients imagine, deliver and run the future, through from customer research right through to implementation. And we love doing it. This role is based in our airy and bustling offices in London, with its legendary coffee machine and model train track, you’ll also have a chance to work with clients throughout Europe and beyond.
Work pattern: This is a permanent opportunity, to be worked on a full time basis. However, our team members work a variety of agile working patterns. Tell us what arrangement works for you and we’ll try to accommodate.
Your professional experience
You will need to have a great understanding of the latest tools and products and platforms, within a variety of different industries, to help our clients not just realise their current goals, but their strategic technological vision for future years to come.
Overall, you’re an ideas person and problem solver as well as a hands-on doer – that’s important. You know it takes a mix of people to do amazing work, so you love collaborating with and learning from people with different skills, backgrounds and perspectives. If you have an interesting or unusual mix of skills yourself, even better.
Essential
Previous experience as a Business Analyst or Analyst Manager
Great at delving into the details, as well as being able to think about the bigger picture and confidently discuss creative ideas, tech and user experience, as conversion rates
Knowledge of agile development process
Previous experience of working in a multi-disciplinary team and working across development, design and clients to gather requirements
Experience with monolithic, layered and microservice architectures
Interest in honing processes, and evaluating new tools
Organised and a collaborator with ability to mentor to junior analysts
Understanding of integration delivery and design
Experience influencing in complex situations where stakeholders do not always agree about methods, choices and strategic direction
Experience of design and implementation of market-leading packages in Salesforce, Amazon Connect, Adobe or similar:
Preferred
Software development background or the ability to understand large, full-stack codebases
Your service line: Consulting
Our people and the way we work are the two things that set us apart in the consulting universe. For us, collaboration is fundamental to success, along with an unrivalled depth and breadth of expertise. We work closely with our clients and each other, at every stage of every project, solving our clients’ trickiest problems with a mix of knowledge, creativity and intellectual rigour. A hugely diverse range of clients rely on us to deliver the kind of change that adds genuine, lasting value to their business.
Personal independence
Regulation and controls are standard practice in our industry and Deloitte is no exception. These controls provide important legal protection for both you and the firm. We are subject to a number of audit regulations, one of which requires that certain colleagues abide by specific personal independence constraints. This can mean that you and your "Immediate Family Members" are not permitted to hold certain financial interests (shares, funds, bonds etc.) with audit clients of the firm. The recruitment team will provide further detail as you progress through the recruitment process.
About Deloitte
Our Purpose & Strategy
To make an impact that matters for our clients, our people and society - defines who we are and what we stand for. Our purpose provides the foundation for our strategy and our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services: this is not about size, it's about being the first choice. The first choice for the largest and most influential clients, and the first choice for the best talent.
What do we do?
Deloitte offers global integrated professional services that include Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Legal, Risk Advisory and Tax Consulting. Our approach combines intellectual leadership, industrial expertise, insight, consulting & problem solving capabilities whatever the role, technology revolutions and innovation from multiple disciplines to help our clients excel anywhere in the world.
Beyond the UK: Deloitte North and South Europe
The UK is part of Deloitte North and South Europe (NSE), the second largest member firm in the Deloitte network. Deloitte NSE combines operations in Belgium, Central Mediterranean (Italy, Greece, Malta), Ireland, the Middle East (Bahrain, Cyprus, Egypt, Iraq, Jordan, Kuwait, Lebanon, Libya, Oman, Palestinian Ruled Territories, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, United Arab Emirates, Yemen), the Netherlands, the Nordics (Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway and Sweden), Switzerland and the UK. Deloitte NSE brings together 2,700 partners and over 50,000 people, combining our unmatched breadth and depth of capabilities in audit and assurance, consulting, financial advisory, risk advisory, and tax and legal across the region. Being part of Deloitte NSE supports our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services and will create more opportunity and growth for our people.
What do we value?
What brings us all together at Deloitte? It’s how we approach the thousands of decisions we make every day. How we behave, our beliefs and our attitudes. In other words: our values. Whatever we do, wherever we are in the world, we lead the way, serve with integrity, take care of each other, foster inclusion, and collaborate for maximum impact. These five shared values lead every decision we make and action we take, guiding us to deliver impact how and where it matters most.
Being a Leader at Deloitte
Cultural fit and purpose-led leadership is crucial for Deloitte. Our leaders always set the example and inspire their colleagues. They make quality time for people and take an interest in them. They know what matters to people - both inside and outside work – and value them as individuals; always finding opportunities to develop them while showing respect and appreciation.
We expect colleagues at all levels to embrace and live our purpose and our leadership culture by challenging themselves to identify issues that are most important for our clients, our people, and for society and make an impact that matters. We know leadership comes in all shapes and sizes, but our Leadership Charter helps all of our people understand what we’re looking for:
We live our purpose: we act as a role model, embracing and living our purpose and values, and recognising others for the impact they make
We develop talent: we develop high-performing people and teams through challenging and meaningful opportunities
We drive performance: we deliver exceptional client service; maximise results and drive high performance from people while fostering collaboration across businesses and borders
We believe positive influence can make an impact that matters: we influence clients, teams, and individuals positively, leading by example and establishing confident relationships with increasingly senior people
We move, together, towards a strategic direction: we understand key objectives for clients and Deloitte, aligning people to objectives and setting priorities and direction.

Job Title: Business Analyst
Location: Remote, work from home anywhere in the UK
Job Summary:
A Business Analyst works in a multi-vendor and multi-systems environment for a large system integration or transformation programs/projects. The Business Analyst will gather and manage detailed requirements through our online incident system. These requirements will be one of the main drivers to continuously improve and enhance our products and services. A close interaction with our clients, Product Management, QA and Engineering is required to gather high-level requirements and assist with refinement and analysis of requirements, implementation and business scenarios. Some of the deliverables, in form of functional requirements, will be used by Engineering to design and implement these requirements.
Duties/Responsibilities:
Creating and revising Business and Technical requirements documents
Documenting business processes, identifying risks and conducting an impact analysis
Identifies and documents business rules, functional capabilities, and business events; relates business rules to the process model and develops an appropriate software configuration for the client
Ensure completeness and accuracy of information captured in our internal incident system
Conducts gap analysis between current and to-be states; identifies gaps and defines and documents requirements to close gaps
Participates in the design of the application’s functional model and system architecture
Identifies and reports risks throughout the life of the project and provides mitigation strategies for those risks
Reviews quality assurance deliverables during the acceptance phase to ensure all requirements have been tested
Acts as the team subject matter expert and coordinates with business partners when more outside information is needed
Trains clients in use of software particular to the clients’ operation
Support our clients utilizing our standard support tools and applications
Note: This is not an exhaustive list of duties and responsibilities, but a summary of work you can expect to complete as a Business Analyst.
Required Skills/Abilities:
Capability to efficiently interact with clients to ascertain the requirements to carry out analysis and design
Proven ability to lead, motivate and work with teams in cross-functional environments
Ability to work as part of a multifunctional team taking direction from Solution Architects
Strong business acumen and excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Hands on Experience and Good exposure to one or more of the following applications Catalog, CPQ or Order Management products
Ability to lead and resolve the requirements/modelling issues, understand the customer documentation to spec out requirements and interface definitions efficiently
Helping Project Manager and Leads in feasibility study, solution chunking and estimation of Projects/Change requests.
Ability to prepare gap analysis based on the customer requirements and product
Travel for short/medium period to customer locations
Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, similar field, or equivalent work experience
3-4 years on Telecom BSS in BSA/Solution Designer capacity
5 years’ experience in gathering Business, Technical and Data requirements
Extensive experience in Unified Modeling Language (UML) methodologies to design Communication Diagram, Use Case Diagrams, Sequence Diagram and class diagrams

We're Hiring! Business Analyst
Who are we?
We’re the biggest e-commerce group that you’ve probably never heard of, yet you’re sure to know about our sites. We’ve been experiencing rapid growth and working hard behind the scenes to firmly make our mark as an environmentally conscious e-commerce powerhouse that is all about providing exceptional service and exceptional products that encourage people to get out there and enjoy life.
We own and run 9 e-commerce sites including Surfdome, Country Attire, Blackleaf and Derby House and we work with some global brands including The North Face, Coach, Rab, and Barbour. We also own 4 creative content sites, so whether you’re looking for the best waves to ride, the top mountains to trek, or which jacket will best protect you from the elements, chances are our Editorial team have got you covered.
Over the last 12 months we’ve grown from a team of 200 to 300+, we’ve added 2 sites to our plethora of brands, and have become an Outstanding place to work as awarded by Best Company. Over the next 12 months we have big plans to elevate our e-commerce service and solutions unit (also known as ReactorX), expand into Europe, and continue to add some awesome brands to the IFG offering.
We’re a fast-paced environment and certainly not for anyone after an easy ride! If you love a challenge, then we’d love to hear from you.
Could this be the job for you?
This brand-new role is the perfect opportunity for an inquisitive and data driven individual who is looking for a new challenge. This could be the job for you if…
You’re all about data! You’ll be responsible for understanding, interpreting and analysing business requirements and processes so you’ll need to know your stuff when it comes to business analytics.
You love working with a wide variety of teams – you’ll be interacting with lots of different stakeholders, users and other representatives to support the improvement of existing systems, so relationship building will be key.
You love a challenge! Our business is fast-paced, dynamic, and incredibly exciting. You’ll be someone who can learn quickly and prioritise effectively!
As a Business Analyst you’ll be a success if…
You support the shaping, leading and delivery of major transformational business, technology and process change projects & programmes - including contributing to feasibility studies, impact assessments, RFI/RFP processes, and business cases.
You apply best practice methods to investigate, analyse and document the business in terms of business functions, processes, and data.
You establish and understand requirements for new business functionalities and work with stakeholders and Product Managers to document and expand on these requirements.
You conduct business process modelling and collaborate with testers to generate applicable scenarios for testing.
You establish and maintain detailed knowledge base of central functions business operations, business processes and systems.
You lead the facilitation of engaging business workshops & interviews with stakeholders from board level to frontline staff.
You translate business needs to actionable system amendments, defining the relationships between user input and system logic, and collaborate with developers to create system definitions.
What you’ll bring…
The good stuff…
Good experience working as a business analyst working with Agile, Lean or other similar software development methodologies.
Experience in planning and managing new product developments from inception to post-go live.
Proven track record in high-level business analysis, improvement initiatives, requirements management and solution design.
Familiar with implementing functionality, deriving learnings and recommendations from collected data.
Familiar with APIs and service driven architecture, comfortable writing user stories and requirements with this in mind.
Able to discuss and agree technical strategy at a high level with developers and align feedback with functional requirements.
Comfortable carrying out database analysis as a part of understanding and documenting business processes.
Have proven experience in writing technical specifications / documentation, user stories and acceptance criteria and be able to work with developers to evolve requirement gathering to improve delivery.
The great stuff…
Experience working with warehousing, shipping, and fulfilment, preferably within an ecommerce setting.
Familiar with purchase ordering and associated tools.
Experience working with a product development roadmap and helping to shape this based on investigation and recommendations.
Comfortable working with C-level stakeholders, able to discuss and evangelise solutions in a collaborative setting.
Experience performing systems analysis through exploratory investigative work, preferably in a self-serve manner using basic technical skills such as SQL querying or data analysis tools.
Familiarity of web application development architectures, simplistic knowledge of front-end web languages supporting proof of concept rapid prototyping strategies.
A note from the hiring manager…
“This is a great opportunity to take part in an ambitious set of changes impacting a complex and fast-growing business. Perfect for someone looking to take a big step in their ability to contribute to change in a business.”
James Baron, Senior Product Manager
Perks of the job…
As a business that is all about getting out there and enjoying life, we wouldn’t be true to our values unless we offered some pretty awesome benefits to help our people to do the same..
True hybrid working - we trust and empower you to work in a way that suits you, your life, and your team.
Market leading discount - We want our people to enjoy and love the products that we sell as much as our customers do, that's why we give you everything at cost price + VAT (We challenge you to find better!)

We work hard, but we relax even harder - You’ll get 25 days annual leave, plus an extra day off for your birthday (Because who wants to wait years for their birthday to fall on a weekend!?)
An annual piece of the pie - When the business does well, it's down to the hard work of our people, that's why we give a discretionary annual bonus based on company performance.
Supporting you through all stages of life - We help you to focus on what really matters during important moments in your life. You’ll get enhanced maternity leave, full shared parental leave, and paid leave should you experience loss of early life.
An Outstanding place to work - It’s official, we’re a Best Company Outstanding Place to work - a badge that we wear with pride and something we will always keep working to continually improve.
We understand that privacy and the security of your personal information is extremely important. Internet Fusion Group collects, processes, and ensures the security of all personal data that we gather in accordance with data protection laws.

About Us

We're an innovative tech consultancy - a team of problem solvers. Since 1993 we've been finding better ways to solve complex technology problems for some of the world's leading organisations and delivered solutions that millions of people use every day.

We bring together experts from diverse backgrounds and experiences in a collaborative and open culture to deliver outstanding outcomes for our clients, and a stimulating and rewarding environment for our people.

Our clients tell us that our people are the best they've worked with – not only because of their professional ability, but also their behaviour and attitude. As part of the BJSS Business Analysis team, you'll develop all these skills, and hone them delivering real engagements for a variety of clients.

About the Role

As a Business Analyst you will be at the heart of improving the lives of our clients.

You will collaborate to tailor solutions which work for their business and work alongside development teams to deliver world-class products.

You will help define the scope of projects, define solution requirements and manage backlogs of upcoming work. To be effective, you will actively seek out and work with others to achieve a shared understanding of the problems to be solved as well as defining their solutions.

We want to give our clients the highest-level of service and we provide friendly 'hands-on' support to better understand their needs and priorities. Our analysts should be experts at asking questions, collecting information and converting into tangible goals.

BJSS prides itself on delivering software using agile methodologies, and Business Analysts continuously feed into the direction and development of the products we produce. Our analysts are flexible and resilient in the face of change and should be able to deputise for other roles where required.

As a consultancy, we empower you to develop your own career path, providing experience across multiple sectors and interesting, exciting challenges.

About You

We feel the best Business Analysts are personable and curious.

You collaborate with others and are able to negotiate and agree on a way forward. You focus on understanding the problem to be solved as much as the solution itself. You think holistically and don't overlook the wider strategic context.

You are able to build rapport quickly with a wide range of people, from CEOs to development staff. You are naturally inquisitive, listen well and are able to collate findings into consumable, easy to understand outputs.

You are resilient and flexible in the face of challenges or criticism and unafraid to get your hands dirty outside of your role where needed. You are well organised and be able to plan your workload effectively.

We value ambitious leaders, unafraid to drive projects forward collaboratively to reach to a cohesive goal.

Ideally you will have tangible experience in requirements elicitation and analysis, stakeholder management, agile delivery, prioritisation and backlog management. You should be willing to continuously develop yourself and learn new skills.

Some of the Perks
A collaborative and inspiring environment working alongside some of the best tech people in the industry
Hybrid working – you can vary your working location to allow you to collaborate better, feed your creativity, and take the time and space to focus when you need it
Training opportunities and incentives – we support professional certifications across engineering and non-engineering roles

We partner with Lifeworks to offer wellbeing support to our employees
Life Assurance (4 x annual salary)

25 days annual leave plus bank holidays
Discounts – we have preferred rates from dozens of retail, lifestyle and utility brands
An industry-leading referral scheme

The University of London is one of the oldest and largest universities in the UK – and the most diverse. We are a federal institution consisting of 17 self-governing Colleges of outstanding reputation and a number of acclaimed central academic bodies. The University of London offers almost every subject covered in any University curriculum, delivering huge flexibility and choice to its students.
Business Intelligence and Planning Analyst
An exciting opportunity has arisen for two data analysts to join the University of London.
As the University moves into the implementation stage of its 2020-2025 Strategy, effective use and analysis of data is fundamental to helping the organisation achieve its ambition to be the ‘UK’s leading provider of distance learning education’. Agile Ways of Working

Good organisational and planning skills and ability to work to deadlines under pressure

A Business Analyst is required on a 24-month fixed term contract paying £39,877.88 plus £2,700.10 London Allowance (if applicable) with British Transport Police (BTP) based in Force Headquarters, Camden, London.

BTP is the national police Force for the rail network throughout Great Britain, including London Underground, across which we ensure the safety and security of nearly 3 billion passenger journeys and over 100 million tons of freight every year. The world in which we work is fast paced, operationally and commercially demanding, and constantly changing.
As a Business Analyst with BTP you will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of BTP as part of our “A Force on the Move” programme which is starting in April 2022.
The post holder will be required to:
Undertake analytical activities and deliver analysis outputs.
Maintain knowledge of developments in data science, providing detailed advice regarding their application.
Elicit and discover requirements from operational management and other stakeholders.
Select appropriate techniques for the elicitation of detailed requirements taking into account the nature of the required changes, established practice and the characteristics and culture of those providing the requirements.
The successful Business Analyst will be required to evidence the following skills & qualifications:
An undergraduate degree in a relevant discipline, preferably with strong statistics or analytical element.
Experience of producing statistical reports, both alone and as part of a wider team.
Proven analytical experience gained through work experience or educational background.
Trained and experienced in using Microsoft Office applications and databases and the use of big data.
Excellent quantitative analytical skills.
Knowledge of both analytical and social science research methodology and statistics.
Further information about this vacancy can be found in the attached job description.
If you are interested in applying to this Business Analyst role then please do not delay as interviews will be held as soon as appropriate candidates are highlighted. In return for your experience, we can offer you:
Salary of £39,877.88 plus £2,700.10 London Allowance (if applicable)
28 days annual leave plus bank holidays
Pension scheme
Other benefits include a bespoke BTP rewards platform and various salary sacrifice schemes such as cycle-to-work and season ticket loan as well as many high street and online retail discounts.
Please note we are currently adopting a Blended Working approach which includes home working, so are also open to discussion regarding a flexible and agile approach to duties.
This is an exciting time to BTP as we embark on our Force on the Move change programme, which is focussed on transforming and modernising our wide-ranging services to become a world class police force. You will have the opportunity to join a national organisation, engaging with many areas of the business to take forward new and exciting ways of working.
We want our organisation to be as diverse as the community it serves and welcome applicants from all sections of the community. In order to apply, you must have the permanent right to live and work in the UK and have been resident in the UK for the previous 5 YEARS. You will be asked these and other questions to determine your eligibility to work for British Transport Police when you start your application, and you must answer honestly.
How to apply?
Please submit a CV and covering letter detailing your suitability for the role and what attracted you to this role.
Your CV and cover letter will need to be submitted in one document under CV upload.
BTP has undertaken a review of Police Staff pensions and as a result of this the Police Staff pension will be changing. The current police staff pension is a Defined Benefit scheme which is administered by the Railways Pension scheme. The new pension scheme which is launching is a Defined Contribution scheme which is administered by Royal London. The new pension scheme is awaiting formal approval and an introductory date is not finalised. The earliest this will be is May 2022. If you have any queries, please contact the recruitment team – recruitmentteam@btp.police.uk
Candidates internal to BTP must confirm that they are not subject to formal action plans for sickness/complaints/discipline or poor performance, that all mandatory training courses have been attended and are in ticket/up to date, that a ‘developing’ rating, or above, was achieved on the last reporting year PDR and they have completed their tenure period (6 months) for current substantive posting.

JOB TITLE: Business Analyst (SDPR) - 12 MONTH FIXED TERM CONTRACT
SALARY: £33,100 - £38,000
POSTING END DATE: 22.02.22
LOCATION: Coventry

Beyond Property, Purchasing, HR and IT, more than being part of our Finance or Marketing teams, beyond even Sales and Service, every role in every business area offers unique opportunities to make an impact on the future of mobility and the automotive industry.
WHAT TO EXPECT
You’ll join us as part of a newly created Supplier Engagement and Performance Function, focussing on driving our Aftermarket Supply base to achieve and improve their SDPR (Supply Performance Delivery Rating) standard.
The main purpose of this role will be to ensure suppliers meet their SDPR requirements within the Aftermarket Supply Team and focus on continuous improvement within our supply base.
As part of the role, you will work with a wide range of stakeholders, both within our Global Supply function, as well as the wider Aftermarket Supply Chain Operations and our 3PL partners.
Existing SDPR Management
SDPR is currently frozen whilst the business brings Land Rover Aftermarket parts supply in-house & the SNC transformation project is ongoing,
You’ll take over the current maintenance of the system to ensure suppliers scores are reset during the freeze period.
You’ll be an active part of the team responsible for ‘unfreezing’ SDPR, liaising with suppliers to inform them of the system updates and ensuring their SDPR scores accurately reflect their performance. This will involve pro-actively contacting suppliers and challenging SDPR non-conformances where appropriate.
Responsible for assessing supplier disputes and if upheld, altering data to resolve any discrepancies in results.
Future state SDPR Management
Track and analyse supplier SDPR scores to identify trends in the performance data. Undertake problem solving activities internally and with suppliers to identify and rectify systemic issues in the supply base.
Produce internal SDPR reports and present them to management level with suggested improvement activities and actions.
Support as required any transformation workstreams to ensure readiness for Mercia. (Consolidation of warehouse activities to a new site end 2022/23)
Work cross functionally both internally, and externally with 3PL’s, to understand and resolve SDPR queries.
Gain full working knowledge of the End-to-End SDPR Process and be a point of contact to help others in their understanding and roles within the process.
Take part in regular stakeholder review to address and overcome noncompliance within the supply base, analyse performance and act on trends.
Work with Global Supply Team and Compliance analysts to drive overall Supplier Performance improvement
As part of the wider Supply Chain Transformation, you will be the SDPR Management representation within various transformational project teams, incl. SPM & Mercia. This will include taking the lead on future process enhancements.
With the Supplier Compliance function being new to the Global Supply Organisation, there is an expectation of growth on the areas of responsibilities as part of the overall transformation.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Track Supplier performance trends, analyse data effectively to make escalation decisions. Support planners through early supplier interventions and lead suppliers through the preliminary escalation levels to issue resolution.
Work with JLR Buyers to resolve any Commercial issues preventing full compliance.
Work with suppliers to ensure the JLR Gold Standard for paperwork is adhered to, escalate and recover any suppliers that are non-compliant.
Develop and implement a governance cadence for reporting the status of SDPR.
Build strong relationships with suppliers, planners and cross functional stakeholders & Co-ordinate proactive SDPR calls with suppliers, record and monitor progress.
Work with your line manager to achieve your yearly objectives and KPI’s
WHAT YOU’LL NEED
Essential Skills:
Resilient and enthusiastic, an individual able to deliver results in a high-pressured environment
An excellent communicator
Ability to work in a complex cross functional network
Strong at stakeholder management with the ability to build strong relationships (internally & externally)
An individual with the ability to prioritise their workload
An idea creator, shaper with an appetite to drive continuous improvement
An effective team player with the Customer First Principles always at the forefront
Technical Skills:
Problem Solving Skills
Proficient in Microsoft Office
Comfortable with large data & reporting
Process Mapping
Desirable Skills
Knowledge of the JLR Supply Base and a broad understanding of the individual functions, and their interdependency, within the Parts Operation.
Knowledge of SAP.
In addition, the appointee ought to:
Be results oriented with a determination to make things happen
Demonstrate an approach driven by business processes (but non-bureaucratic)
Be able to act with initiative and prioritise appropriately
A broad understanding Customer Service and the Global Aftermarket Parts Operation
Demonstrate and utilise the Customer First Principles.
SO WHY US?
Bring all this to the home of premium innovation, and you’ll find the opportunities to further your career with a world-class team, a discounted car purchase and lease scheme for you and your family, membership of a competitive pension plan and performance related bonus scheme. All this and more makes Jaguar Land Rover the perfect place to continue your journey.
This role may offer the opportunity for hybrid working where you can split your time between working from home and in the office. At Jaguar Land Rover, hybrid working is a voluntary, non-contractual arrangement providing employees with more choice and flexibility around how, when and where they work, if suitable for their role. Further details can be discussed with the Hiring Manager at interview stage.

2db24576046dee61.description:
Business Analyst, Commercial Excellence
Do you have expertise in, and passion for, Business Analyst? Would you like to apply your expertise to impact a company that follows the science and turns ideas into life changing medicines? If so, AstraZeneca might be the one for you!
ABOUT ASTRAZENECA
AstraZeneca is a global, innovation-driven BioPharmaceutical business that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialisation of prescription medicines for some of the world’s most serious disease. But we’re more than one of the world’s leading pharmaceutical companies.
At AstraZeneca we’re dedicated to being a Great Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and unleash your entrepreneurial spirit. There’s no better place to make a difference to medicine, patients and society. An inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration. Always committed to lifelong learning, growth and development.
ABOUT OUR IT TEAM
Here our work has a direct impact on patients – transforming our ability to develop life-changing medicines. We empower the business to perform at its peak and lead a new way of working, combining cutting-edge science with leading digital technology platforms and data. All with a passion to impact lives through data, analytics, AI, machine learning and more. Join us at a crucial stage of our journey in becoming a digital and data-led enterprise. Make the impossible possible by building partnerships and ecosystems, creating new ways of working
and driving scale and speed to deliver exponential growth. Focused and committed, and backed with the investment to succeed, we’re driving cross-company change to disrupt the entire industry. Ours is a place to innovate, take ownership and run with it. You’re trusted to explore and to find new solutions, experimenting with leading-edge technology and grappling with challenges in a modern technology environment that might never have been tackled before. It’s a dynamic and challenging environment to work in – but that’s why we like it. There are countless opportunities to learn and grow, whether that’s exploring new technologies in hackathons, or transforming the roles and work of colleagues, forever. Shape your own path, with support all the way. Diverse minds that work cross-functionally and inclusively together. Be part of a team that has the backing to innovate, disrupt an industry and change lives.
ABOUT THE ROLE?
The Business Analyst has experience performing business analysis and design either alone delivering small scale business change activities, or as a contributor to a large scale or global business change. The Business Analyst operates with interactive communication, demonstrating inclusion and cultural sensitivity.
The role will partner with Business Relationship Manager and Business Analyst colleagues to support the development of business cases, assist in business process design and ensure that proposed solutions meet established AstraZeneca quality and compliance standards and business solution needs.
Accountabilities:
Business Needs Identification - Operates at a functional level in assessing and defining business need and areas for improvement. Proactively seeks out opportunities to enhance and improve in line with strategic goals, proposing potential solutions through research.
Business Analysis Planning - Selects the appropriate analysis approach to a piece of work depending on its complexity, level of risk, known assumptions, constraints and dependencies. Proficient in scoping and recommending appropriate approaches. Capable of planning and managing their own activities to meet deliverables and deadlines.
Requirements Analysis and Design Definition - Responsible for requirements management plans including elicitation, approvals, processes, RAID and scope impacts. Skilled in traceability, testing and validation. Supports the work with the business to identify functional and technical requirements, translating the requirements into design specifications reflecting Functional Design, User Interface Design and Business Process Design. Closely partnering with the Architecture team, ensuring the technical solution will deliver the agreed business benefits.
Solution Evaluation - Analyzes and supports assessment of solution proposals and is able to articulate supporting reasoning; i.e. assessing business readiness, maximizing value vs. spend.
Business Case and Benefits Management – Supports the business case definition, capturing business justification for investment including ROI and benefits realization.
Stakeholder Management - Effectively collaborates with stakeholders and builds and maintains relationships according to individual stakeholder needs and levels of influence. Contributes to communication plans and change management for project and stakeholders.
Work collaboratively with:
Business Relationship Managers and Business Analysts to develop and maintain the business relationship, support business process change and act as point of contact for application development
Business customers to identify business requirements and effectively communicate impact, cost and benefits of new and changed demands, support or facilitate User Acceptance Testing.
Process owners to identify and devise solutions that optimize business process performance, capability and competitiveness.
IT Architecture, Delivery, and Support to ensure clear understanding of requirements and effective testing so that the solutions delivered to the business are efficient and effective, meeting the customer experience expectations.
Test Lead to define the testing approach and the components of testing to ensure traceability of requirements and effectiveness of overall solution.
Change Management/Communication Lead to ensure the Change Management and Communications plans and delivery support the Stakeholder Analysis.
Education, Qualifications, and Experience:
Essential:
Experience using business analysis tools/techniques to design and deliver business change
Strong engagement, communication and facilitation skills, including presentation and influencing skills
Experience working in a regulated environment
Experience working with third party suppliers/vendors
Business acumen
Challenge, negotiation, and influence
Stakeholder Management
Business Process Management
Requirements Management
Desirable:
Pharmaceutical business awareness, business domain knowledge
Experience with capabilities leveraged by commercial units (CRM, MDM, etc.)
Degree in relevant discipline or formal certification in business analysis practice
Exposure to Agile Methodology
Experience working in a global organization
User Centered Design (User Experience, User Interface Design and Business Process Design)
WHY JOIN US?
We’re a network of entrepreneurial self-starters who contribute to something far bigger. There’s a diversity of expertise in our Technology group that’s unique to AstraZeneca – it allows us to dive deep into
exploring new leading-edge technology. We enable AstraZeneca to perform at its peak by delivering world-class technology and data solutions. Our work unlocks the potential of science. We optimise and evolutionise AstraZeneca by maximising efficiencies and finding new ways to drive productivity. From automation to data simplification. We’re not afraid to take ownership and run with it. Empowered with unrivalled freedom. A place to be open and transparent – we speak up, think creatively and share ideas. Our diverse contributions help us to make better decisions. But we have a constant drive to innovate,
and an appreciation for high standards. It takes challenging the status quo to add value in our ever-evolving environment. We love it here because put simply, we make a meaningful impact.
Technology at AstraZeneca is a home for purposeful disruptors!
SO, WHAT’S NEXT?
Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Good, because we’d love to hear from you! Click the link to apply and we’ll be in touch as soon as we can.
WHERE CAN I FIND OUT MORE?
